name: Louis XIV
title: The Sun King
description: Known for his absolute monarchy and the construction of the Palace of Versailles. His reign of 72 years is the longest of any European monarch.
achievements: Built the magnificent Palace of Versailles
Established French cultural dominance in Europe

name: François I
title: King of France
description: Renaissance monarch who brought Italian Renaissance culture to France and was a great patron of the arts.

name: Henri II
title: King of France
description: Son of François I, continued Renaissance building projects and was married to Catherine de' Medici.

name: Catherine de' Medici
title: Queen of France
description: Queen consort and later regent of France, known for her political influence and patronage of the arts.

name: Louis XIII
title: The Just
description: Father of Louis XIV, established the foundations of absolute monarchy with Cardinal Richelieu.

name: Philippe Auguste
title: Philip II of France
description: First French king to use the title 'King of France' rather than 'King of the Franks', greatly expanded royal domain.
achievements: Tripled the size of French royal domain
Defeated John of England at Bouvines

name: Louis IX
title: Saint Louis
description: Only French king to be canonized, known for his piety, justice reforms, and crusading activities.

name: Diane de Poitiers
title: Duchess of Valentinois
description: Mistress of King Henri II, received Château de Chenonceau as a gift and oversaw its famous bridge construction.
achievements: Influential court figure during Henri II's reign
Commissioned the iconic bridge at Chenonceau
Influential in court politics and culture
